title: Bar Graph Function Block
description:
BAR_GRAPH is a level Detector, which activates depending on the input
value an output. The threshold for the LOW and HIGH Outputs can be set
by the setup variables TRIGGER_LOW and TRIGGER_HIGH. LOW is TRUE if
X is less than TRIGGER_LOW and HIGH is true if X is greater or equal than
TRIGGER_HIGH. If the setup variables ALARM_LOW and / or ALARM_HIGH
set to TRUE, the output ALARM set to TRUE if the value will be lower than
TRIGGER_LOW or exceed of TRIGGER_HIGH , and the output LOW or HIGH
and ALARM remains TRUE until the input RST is TRUE and the alarm is re￾seted. The outputs Q1 to Q6 divide the area between between
TRIGGER_LOW and TRIGGER_HIGH in seven equal areas. If the setup varia￾ble LOG_SCALE is set, the area between TRIGGER_LOW and
TRIGGER_HIGH is divided logarithmically. 
The output Status is an ESR compliant output and forwards states and
alarms to ESR components.
Status
110 Input is between Trigger_Low and Trigger_High.
111 Input lower than Trigger_Low , Output LOW is TRUE
112 Input higher than Trigger_High , Output HIGH is TRUE.
1 Input lower than Trigger_low and Alarm_Lowis TRUE
2 Input higher than Trigger_high and Alarm_High is TRUE
The following example shows a signal characteristic of n Bar_Graph:
name: BAR_GRAPH

input.name: X
input.description: The current value to be evaluated against the trigger thresholds.

input.name: rst
input.description: Reset signal to clear alarms and output states.

input.name: trigger_Low
input.description: The lower threshold for triggering the alarm and bar graph outputs.

input.name: trigger_High
input.description: The upper threshold for triggering the alarm and bar graph outputs.

input.name: Alarm_low
input.description: Indicates if a low alarm is enabled.

input.name: Alarm_high
input.description: Indicates if a high alarm is enabled.

input.name: log_scale
input.description: Indicates if a logarithmic scale should be applied to the graph representation.

output.name: LOW
output.description: Indicates if the value is below the low trigger threshold.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Status of the first bar in the graph.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Status of the second bar in the graph.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Status of the third bar in the graph.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Status of the fourth bar in the graph.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Status of the fifth bar in the graph.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Status of the sixth bar in the graph.

output.name: HIGH
output.description: Indicates if the value is above the high trigger threshold.

output.name: Alarm
output.description: Indicates if any alarm condition has been triggered.

output.name: Status
output.description: Current status code indicating the state of the evaluation.
